div.p: The Groundes of Religion neceſſarie to be knowen of euery one that may be admitted to the Supper of the Lord.
Plainly ſet downe in Queſtions & Anſweres, by M. DVDLEY FENNER, Preacher of the worde of God, in Midlebrugh.
AT MIDLEBRVGH Imprinted by Richard Schilders.

div.head: Thoſe grounds of Religion, which are neceſſarie to be knowne of euery one that may be admitted to the Supper of the Lorde.

p.label: QVESTION.
p.hi: WHat is God?

div.p: ANSVVERE. He isIohn 4.24 a Spirit,Exo. 3.14. Iam. 1.17. 1. Ioh. 1.1.5 and 4.16. Eſay. 43.12. Iere. 4.25. Iob. 36.5. and 37.22. Nah. 1.2.3. Hab. 3.3 4 5 Gen. 1.31. Pſal. 145.17 who hath no qualities or ſhadowe of chaunge in him, but whoſe very being is moſt mighty, moſt iuſt, moſt merercifull, and therefore hath made all thinges good, and gouuerned all things well,

p.label: Qv.
p.hi: What is the bleſſed Trinitie?

div.p: AN. ThreeHag. 2.5, 6 1. Iohn. 5.7. Math. 28.19 Ioh. 14.26. Gal. 4.6. 2 Cor. 13.13 perſons diſtinguiſhed by their proper difference, but not ſeparated one from another, becauſe euerie one of them is one and the ſame God:Pro. 8.22. Ioh 1.1.14 24 1 Cor. 8.6. The Father of none:Math 3.17 Luk. 2.49. The Sonne begotten of the Father before all beginninges:Ioh. 15.26 Iohn. 3.16. & 3.18. 1 Ioh. 4.9. Pſalm 2.7. Heb. 1.5. Act 16.7. Rom. 8.9.11. Cor. 2.12. The Holie Ghoſt proceeding from the Father & the Sonne.

p.label: Qv.
p.hi: Seeing we were
were all in Adam made good, according to God his image, howe and in what ſorte are you corrupted?

div.p:
AN. By theEccle. 7.31. Rom. 5.13.14. willinge fall of Adam, I
with all menne in his loynes,The corrupte 〈◊◊〉 man. deſerued to beIoh. • .25 Ephe 2.1. borne ſo dead in ſinne, as I can haue no true ſeede or beginninge of goodneſſe in me, vntill both
〈…〉 3 • . •• 2. Cor. 3.3. my ſtonie heart be taken away and a newe heart be wholie giuen mee of God, without whoſe eſpeciall grace (although I can by the common gifte giuen to all men, vnderſtand, reaſon, will, and deſire) yet I haue no power toGen. 6.5. & 8.21. incline or mooue any of theſe as I ſhould doe accordinge to God his will.

p.label: Q.
p.hi: In what caſe ſtande you by meanes of this corruption?

div.p: AN. I am theEp. 2.1.2 childe of wrath and euerlaſting damnation.

p.label: Qv.
p.hi: What doth the leaſt ſinne, as euery euill m •••… n, or the not perfect co ••••• ance in doeing the whole Lawe of God deſerue, both before and after faith?

div.p: AN. That which the Apoſtle ſaith,Gal. 3.10. Curſed, that is, euerlaſting •• condemned as he, that continueth not to 〈◊◊〉 whiche is written in the books of the Lawe.

p.label: Qv.
p.hi: Then can we not be ••••… ſled, that is, acqu •••… ed before God • is iudgement ſeate, by thoſe •• od workes, which proceed from faith?

div.p:
AN. No: for the moſt worthie obedience of Abraham, comming from his faith, did not iuſtifie him, but onelyRō. 4.3.4.5. his faith which was accounted to him for righteouſnes: And
if the Lorde will marke what is done amiſſe by his righteous ſeruaunt, Pſa. 130.3. and 143.2. who can abyde it?

p.label: Qv.
p.hi: Howe are we then acquitted before God his iudgement ſeate?

div.p: The reſtauration of man in Chriſt. AN Onely by the imputation of Chriſt his death & obedience,Gal. 3.13. 2. Cor. 5.21. Eſai. 53.3.4. who was made a curſe to redeeme the elect frō the curſe of the lawe, who knowing no ſinne, was made ſinne for the elect, that is, had all their ſinne ſo accounted to him, as that he might beare the puniſhment of it: to this ende, that they might by the ſame way, bee made God his righteouſnes in him, not in them ſelues.

p.label: Qv.
p.hi: Howe can we be made partakers of this iustification in Christ
after wee knowe one God and three perſons, the Father, the Sonne, and the holy Ghost: and that Christ is perfect God and perfect man?

div.p: AN. Onely by2 Tim. 1.3 Tit. 1.1. Gal. 3.26.27 Ephe. 3.17. the vnfained faith of the elect, which is that faith, whereby wee are able to receyue Chriſt.

p.label: Qv.
p.hi: Howe doe ye knowe that yee haue that faith?

div.p: AN. By the true marke which the Apoſtle giueth, ſaying:2 Cor. 13.5. Proue your ſelues, whether ye be in the faith or no, whether Christ be in you or no.

p.label: Qv.
p.hi: Howe may we know Christ to be in vs?

div.p: AN By the three1. Ioh. 5.6.7. benefites wherewith he commeth vnto vs, bloud, water, & ſpirit.
Qv What is meant by Bloud?
AN. l. Pe. 1.2.3. Rom. 4.25. Act. 20.28. Our iuſtification cōſiſting in Chriſt his righteouſnes, & the forgiuenes of ſinne by his bloud-ſheadding.
Qv. What is meant by Water?

AN. OurHeb. 10.22 Tit. 2.11.12 ſanctification, when the grace of God teacheth vs to denie vngodlines, vnrighteouſnes, and worldly luſtes, to liue godly, righteouſly, and ſoberly in this preſent worlde.

p.label: Qv.
p.hi: Howe ſhall we knowe that we feele both this true mortifying or denying of ſinne, and true liuing to righteouſnes?

div.p: AN. When both from a true2. Co. 7.11 1. Pet. 4.2 ſorrowe according to God, for euery thing we knowe forbidden of God (yea the leaſt) as all light othes, idle wordes, profitable lyes, or vaine actions, we feele a ſtudie to auoyde the firſt motions to them, a clearing of our ſelues from all ſuſpition of them, by anoyding all appearance of euill, an indignation for all ſuch things paſt, a feare, leaſt ſuch thinges by our corruption ſhould fall out againe: a great deſire to preuent them: a zeale againſt them, and a puniſhinge of them by exerciſing all due authoritie which God hath giuen vs againſt ſinne: as alſo a great ſtudie to ſpende all the rest of our time, not according to the will of men, but accordinge to the will of God.

p.label: Qv.
p.hi: What is ment by the Spirit?

div.p: AN. That full aſſurance which theGal. 4.6. Rō. 8.15.16. Ep. 1.13.14. and 4.30. 1. Pet. 1.5. Holie Ghost worketh in our heartes that wee are God his children, whereby we are ſealed vnto the day of redemption, that is, fully aſſured that wee ſhall be kept by the power of GOD through faith vnto ſaluation.

p.label: Qv.
p.hi: By what ordinary means is that true faith and that which followeth it, wrought in vs?

div.p: AN. By the preching of the goſpel.The meanes of the working, exerciſing, confirming, and increaſing of faith, and the fruites of it. Rō 10.14

p.label: Qv.
p.hi: What is the cauſe that ſo manie heare the preaching of the Gospell, yea doe receiue it wit • ſome
tast, ioy, & vnderſtanding, and yet obteine not this faith and the fruite of it?

div.p: AN. Matt. 11.25.26. Luke. 11.34 Act. 13.48. Rom. 8.30. Ro 9.11.12 18.22.23. Eph. 1.4.5. 1. Theſ. 5.9. 2. The. 2.13 1. Pet. 2.8. Iud. 4. The cauſe is the vnchangeable purpoſe of God from before all beginninges, wherein he hath (beinge moued onely by his own holy will) appointed freely to chuſe ſome to Christ vnto ſaluation through faith, for the prayſe of his riche grace: And iuſtly to caſt awaye others, when they ſhould by their owne default deſerue the ſame. Nowe this foundation ſtandeth ſure, and hath this ſeale, that the Lorde knoweth who are his: but for our owne aſſurance, Let euerie one departe from iniquitie which calleth on the name of Ieſus.

p.label: Qv.
p.hi: What meanes beſides the ſeruice of God at home, muſt we chieflie vſe, to exerciſe, confirme, and nouriſhe this faith and the fruites thereof?

div.p: AN. We muſt diligentlie vſe all the workes of the publike Miniſtrie, which are preſcribed of God,Act 2.42. Ro 12.5.6.7 1 Cor. 12.28 as prayer, doctrine, exhortation, the Sacramentes, & communicating vnto the poore.

p.label: Qv.
p.hi: What is a Sacrament?

div.p: AN. It is1. Cor. 12.13. 1. Pet. 3.21. Rom. 4.11. a ſeale wherein by the outwarde and publike workes, reſpecting both the Miniſter & the Church, preſcribed of God, and ioyned with the inwarde workes aunſwering vnto them, is more (then in the worde only preached) liuely repreſented, and truely offered vnto all, but aſſuredlie aplied to the true members of Chriſt only, Chriſt Jeſus and the couenant of grace, fully ratified in him. For the liuely repreſenting they are called ſignes: for the effectuall aſſuring and applying ſeales.

p.label: Qv.
p.hi: What are the outward workes?

div.p: AN. They areMa. 28.19. Act. 2.42 & 19.4.5. and 20.7. Ephe. 5.26. Act. 22. • 6. Ma 16.26.27 1. Co. 10.16 17. & 11.23 24.25.26. for the Miniſter, firſt to put apart the outwarde element or ſigne, by opening the inſtitution and couenaunt of God, by praying and giuing thankes. Secondly, to applie the ſame as is cōmanded.Lu. • .59. Act. 2.42. 1. Co. 10.16 17 & 11.22. For the people to ioyne in hearinge and prayer, and to haue this ſigne ſo applyed.1 Co. 10.1 2.3 & 12.13 Now of Sacraments, there are onlie theſe two: Baptiſme, and the Lordes Supper.

p.label: Qv.
p.hi: What is Baptiſme?

div.p:
AN. Mat, 3.11. Act. 22.16. 1. Pet. 3.21. Ro. 6.1. &c. The firſt Sacrament, wherein by the
Miniſters once waſhing with water, into the name of the Father, the Sonne, and the holie Ghoſt, is more firmly applied, Chriſt his once ingrafting of vs into himſelfe, for the waſhing of vs by the holie Ghoſt, for our full iuſtification and continuall ſanctification in his righteouſneſſe, death, burial, and his reſurrection.

p.label: Qv.
p.hi: What is the Lordes Supper?

div.p:
AN. Matt. 26.26.27. 1 Co. 10.1.2.3.15.16.17. 1 Cor. 12.1 •
The ſecond Sacrament, wherein by the Miniſter his putting apart, his breaking powring forth and giuinge of breade and wine, by the Churches receyuing, eating & drinking of the ſame, the faithfull haue more fullie applied their daily & more effectuall receiuing by faith, of the body and blud of Chriſt, for the ſpiritual nouriſhing of their ſoules in iuſtification and ſanctification vnto eternall life.

p.label: Qv.
p.hi: When wee come to the Supper of the Lord, how muſt we prepare our ſelues before, behaue our ſelues in the preſent worke, and reape fruite by it continually after?

div.p:
AN. Eſa. 66.2. • 1. Co. 11.28 31. & 10.1.2 2 Chr 30.19 • . Cor. 13.5 Pſa. 29.3.4. Ma. 5.23.24 Before we muſt trie our ſaith and repentance, not onely whether they be true, but alſo howe wee growe in them, what is the dulneſſe and weaknes of them, that we may the more feruentlie ſeeke the quickning and ſtrengthning of them in this Sacrament. In the preſent worke, we muſt
haue1. Cor. 10.16. with Ioh. 17 1.2.3. &c. in euery outward action, the inward feeling of that which is ſignified by it, as in the putting a-part of the bread and wine, we muſt feele more aſſuredly, that Chriſtes bodie & bloud was put a-part by his prayers, to be the foode of our ſoules:Mark. 14.24. 1. Co. 11.24 Eſai. 5.3.5. by the breaking of the bread, and powring forth of the wine, that his body was crucified. & his bloud ſhed for vs: by the giuing and receyuing1. Co. 10.15.16 and 11 23.24.25. Marke. 14.2 • .23.24. of them, that his body & bloud is preſentlie more liuely giuen vnto vs, and receyued by faith,1. Co. 10.2.3. 1. Co. 12.13. Mat. 14.22.23.24.25, 26 Pſal. 26.7.8 by the eating & drinking, for the nouriſhinge of our bodies, that our ſoules ſo ioyfullie feede on Chriſt by faith, as we are more fully aſſured of the forgiuenes of all, eſpeciallie particular ſinnes, of greater grace to leaue them, of eternall life in ſoule and body, as wee doe with heauenlie conſolation, ſinge prayſes vnto God, for the redemption of the world. After, by the meditation hereof,Pſa. 51.6. Can 2.5. 2. Co. 13.3.4.5. wee muſt be ſtrengthened in all temptations, which are againſt our iuſtifictiō & ſanctification.

p.note: Th • meanes of • ecoueringe a • inner.
p.label: Qv.
p.hi: What meanes are left to recouer thoſe ſinners which are fallen into any ſinne knowne to man, whom the preachinge of the worde of it ſelfe doth not reforme?

div.p:
AN.
• . Math. 18. • 5.10. • am. 5.16. • 9. Th • re are lefte for piuate offences (that is, ſuch as are obſerued of vs, and not otherwiſe notorious) priuate admonition:
firſt by our ſelues, and if that worke not reformation, in the preſence of one or two more.Mat. 18.16.17. 1. Theſ. 5.12 Rom. 12.6.7.8. 1. Co. 12.28 Heb. 13.17. For publike offences, (of whiche ſorte alſo are priuate offēces where amendment followeth not the ſeconde degree of admonition, the ſame beinge declared to the Gouuernours of the ſame particular Churche,) the rebukes and exhortations of the Miniſters and Elders. If that worke not amendement,2. The. 3.14. 1. Co. 5.11. Luk. 6.22. Gen. 4.2.3.4 Iob. 42.7.8. Iere. 36.5. Ma. 5.23.24 1. Co. 11.28 Nu 14.42.44 A markinge of them out by ſeparatinge them from the Communion. And laſt of all, if they amende not by thatMa. 18.1 • 1. Co. 5.1.7 3. &c. Gen. 17.14. Leuit. 7.25.26.27. Heb. 10.8. Num. 19.13 Gal. 5.12. 1. Tim. 1.1 •
after orderly notifying it to the Churche with the conſent of the ſame, which is when no iuſt exception is taken, Excōmunicatiō, or deliuering to Satan, for the deſtructiō of the fleſh, & ſauing of the ſpirit in the day of the Lord: ſo that vppon good tokens of repentaunce, and publike confeſſion,2. Cor. 2.6.7.8. &c. he bee receyued into the Church againe.

q.p: Let the worde of God dwell plenteouſlie in you with all wiſdome, teaching and admoniſhing your own ſelues in Pſalmes & Hymnes and ſpirituall Songes, ſinginge with a grace in your heart to the Lorde.
